metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3622 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the hivex library. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted Windows Registry (hive) file, which would cause hivex to recursively call the _get_children() function, leading to a stack overflow. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

criterions.comment: hivex: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
